subject: Philosophy
title: Existentialism in Therapy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Existentialism in Therapy.

hook.text: A patient says 'I don't know who I am.' An existential therapist replies: 'Good. Now we can begin.'

buildup.text: Existential therapy doesn't fix symptoms. It explores your relationship with freedom, death, and meaning.

discovery.text: Irvin Yalom identified four existential concerns: death, freedom, isolation, and meaninglessness.

twist.text: These aren't problems to solve. They're conditions of being human that you must learn to face.

climax.text: The goal isn't happiness. It's an honest, engaged life â€” which sometimes includes suffering.

punchline.text: The cure isn't comfort. It's confrontation.

quiz.question: What are Yalom's four existential concerns?
